column4: hi everyone, does someone have any suggestions on the following? When I log out I get a blank screen.
and the computer is frozen?
do you have an ATI card with the ATI drivers?
yes I have an ATI card, and had to enable the restricted driver
aha, that could be the problem (I had the same one)
do you use the accelerated 3D at all?
Not sure if it's being used
well, it's a bit of a hack, but I disable it by enabling the Composite extension in xorg.conf (this will cause the driver to disable fast 3D support though)
ok I'll try that
it's Composite "Enable" I think
and you need to restart for it to take effect
ok thanks
Thanks that fixed my problem!
great!
hopefully it won't be necessary when ATI fix the problem
do you by any chance know why I would not be able to set permissions on my Hard Drives?
which hard drives? and what file system are they?
External drive
ah, external drives are often formatted FAT32, which doesn't support permissions
so shall I format using what system?
ext3 is what Linux/Ubuntu use, and supports all the features
gparted should be able to show you the drive, and let you reformat it
Thank you I'll try that.
